review: The Fire TV does what I need it do. It streams Netflix, Amazon Prime video (if you have Prime), and you can download other streaming apps. I can say that the whole "gaming" aspect is really underwhelming. Most of the games available in the Amazon store are smartphone or tablet games, I bought a controller to use with the Fire TV before I realized there were very few free games worth playing.The voice search is very accurate and convenient, but it ONLY searches Amazon's library. If you are in the Netflix app and do a voice search for a show, it will show you results from Amazon's library. As is usually the case with Amazon products, its designed to sell you more stuff.For my needs, I could have bought a Chrome stick or the Amazon Fire Stick for less than half the price and still been able to stream Netflix. I'm hoping more content becomes available on the Fire TV in the future to actually put the extra hardware to use.

review: I bought this for my wife who streams shows on Netflix.  We already had the Apple TV but needed another box for a second TV in the house.  There were some initial issues when trying to set this up but my wife called Amazon Customer Service and they walked her through the process of upgrading the firmware and now it works fine.  So far the streaming has been flawless and if you are just streaming Netflix I think it's a great value compared to the Apple TV.

review: The product is great, but there is one design flaw that is truly annoying and Amazon should fix in the next software update. Photos that I backup to Amazon cloud drive show up automatically on the Fire TV. I don't want that. Photos are private. There's an option to force parental controls for photos but that's just a hack solution and forces everything else to be locked as well. The correct solution is a setting that says to disable Photos completely or to choose not to sync with an Amazon account.
